text: one thing to note is that this has to be done within a require_js block in the HTML. You can’t call it from the JS file. I had this same issue a couple weeks ago and spent a few hours banging my head on my desk.

<@UDHT6N5SM> `|tojson` covered most cases for me. But there were some formatting snaffus in the past when it came to various strings and what not.<https://devbeej.com/library/advanced-exporting-HubSpot-blogs/| Here is a blog post> I wrote up a few years ago. Different concept — but you might be able to gleam some things from it for what youre trying to do.

I’ve built a few features in the past on partner projects that pulled module data into a vue instance and I always did that by just hitting `module|tojson` and passing that into a global script variable. Then in the vue app would grab that data on beforeMount and then hydrate.
Can you insert the default HubSpot unsubscribe email into the third party email tool?
